definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I hate bugs, they give me the willies.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭蟲子，他們使我很害怕。

sentences.english: But what about bugs no bigger than the raindrops themselves?
sentences.chinese: 但是比雨點還小的小蟲子們，它們的情況怎麼樣呢？

sentences.english: When I think of summer I think of all the bugs.
sentences.chinese: 一想到夏天，我的腦子裏就想到那些蟲子。

sentences.english: I used weedkiller to get rid of the weeds in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我用殺蟲劑來除掉花園裏的蟲子。

sentences.english: Eventualy we have to adjust to the environment where fruits are always with worms.
sentences.chinese: 最終我們只得適應水果總會有蟲子的環境。

sentences.english: Looks a bit like a worm so we call them space-time worms.
sentences.chinese: 看起來有點像蟲子，所以我們稱爲時空蟲。

sentences.english: Ants are fond of sweet food. They often milk little bugs called antcows.
sentences.chinese: 它們常常擠一種叫做蚜蟲的小蟲子的液汁喫。

sentences.english: The worm(s) then releases thousands of larvae (baby worms) into the water.
sentences.chinese: 這些蟲子便會將數千個幼蟲釋放到水裏。

sentences.english: "Why, " demanded his mother, "are you playing with that worm?
sentences.chinese: 他的母想知道爲什麼就問他‘是你在玩蟲子？

sentences.english: We are all worms , but I do believe I am a glowworm.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是小蟲子，但我相信我是一隻螢火蟲。

sentences.english: Some unknown bugs have also been the arrival of I frighten of running around.
sentences.chinese: 一些不知名的小蟲子也被我的到來嚇的四處逃竄。

sentences.english: Now, some people might look down on worm's nechanics, call it immoral.
sentences.chinese: 可能有些人看不起蟲子出老千，認爲這是不道德的。

sentences.english: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.
sentences.chinese: 次日黎明，神卻安排一條蟲子咬這蓖麻，以致枯槁。

sentences.english: Green bugs on the pumpkin leaf.
I caught the insect by inverting my mug over it.
sentences.chinese: 我把茶缸倒過來捉住了那隻蟲子。

definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
both ends/both parties to a deal
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
